Source: parsetype.js

'use strict'

const { nextDocToken } = require('./tags')
const { requireToken } = require('./reporterror')

/**
 * my test
 * @param {...number} myparam a param
 * @param {?number|integer} other a param
 * @param {!number} other a param
 */
function test (myparam, other) {
}

/**
 * @private
 * @description
 * Parses a single type
 * @param {Tokenizer} tokenizer provides token
 * @returns {string} type description
 */
function _parseSingleType (tokenizer) {
    const terminatingToken = ['|', ')', '}', '[', ']', '', '*/']
    let result = ''
    const isObject = (tokenizer.token === '{')
    if (isObject) {
        nextDocToken(tokenizer)
    }
    while (!terminatingToken.includes(tokenizer.token)) {
        result += tokenizer.token
        if (tokenizer.token === ',') {
            result += ' '
        }
        nextDocToken(tokenizer)
    }
    if (tokenizer.token === '[') {
        nextDocToken(tokenizer)
        requireToken(tokenizer, 'missing ] in type array definition', ']')
        result = 'Array.<' + result + '>'
    }
    if (isObject) {
        result = 'Object.<' + result + '>'
        requireToken(tokenizer, 'missing } in type object definition', '}')
    }
    return result
}

/**
 * @private
 * @description
 * Extracts the type from a parameter description
 * @param {Tokenizer} tokenizer provides token
 * @returns {Object} with property types
 */
function parseType (tokenizer) {
    const terminatingToken = ['}', '', '*/']
    const result = { type: '' }
    if (tokenizer.token === '{') {
        nextDocToken(tokenizer)
        while (!terminatingToken.includes(tokenizer.token)) {
            if (tokenizer.token === '(' || tokenizer.token === ')') {
                nextDocToken(tokenizer)
            } else if (tokenizer.token === '|') {
                result.type += ', '
                nextDocToken(tokenizer)
            } else {
                result.type += _parseSingleType(tokenizer)
            }
        }
        requireToken(tokenizer, 'missing } in type definition', '}')
    }
    return result
}

module.exports = { parseType }
